Description: This session will present the rationale and need for novel screening tests for colorectal cancer, scientific basis and results of early and late phase studies of candidate stool and blood-based non-invasive screening tests, and the potential opportunities and pitfalls associated with emergence of novel non-invasive tests. The discussion will include strategies for optimizing study design and interpretability, and ensuring that the impacts of novel strategies are both equitable across populations, and optimally positioned to maximize early detection and prevention of colorectal cancer.
SearchResultBody: AOS03. Emerging Non-invasive Tests for Colorectal Cancer Screening: Potential Opportunities and Pitfalls
Title: Emerging Non-invasive Tests for Colorectal Cancer Screening: Potential Opportunities and Pitfalls
